descripcion:
The avocado tree is a perennial type fruit specie, which presents a different growing behavior from other fruit trees.

The length and season of phenological stages depend on the variety, climate and geographic place. For the Hass variety, the most cultivated in Chile.

imagenes.span: Avocado leaves: Left- N- deficient leaf. Center leaf low in N. Right- normal leaf concerning N status.
Avocado nursery: Fornt- plants growing in a substrate devoid of N. Back- plants having been supplied with N fertilizer.
Avocado leaves. Left, normal. Right, nitrogen deficient.
Fruits and leaves of 'Hass' avocado. Left- From a non nutrient deficiency tree. Right- From a tree deficient in both K and Zn.
Avocado leaf showing symptoms of Mg- deficiency and excess chloride (Cl- uptake (necrosis)).
Mg- deficiency symptoms in an avocado branch.
Avocado with Magnesium deficiency.
'Hass' avocado fruits. Left- fruits taken from a healthy tree. Center- fruits taken from a tree showing moderate Fe- deficiency. Right- fruits from a tree showing severe Fe- deficiency.
Fe- chlorosis in young avocado trees.
Avocado leaf showing symptoms of Fe- deficiency and Cl- toxicity (tip burn).
Leaf symptoms of Fe- chlorosis in avocado.
Avocado with iron chlorosis
Leaf symptoms of Mn- deficiency in avocado.
Avocado leaf showing symptoms of Mn- deficiency and Cl- toxicity (leaf border necrosis).
Avocado leaves: Right- leaves showing symptoms of Zn- deficiency. Left- healthy leaf.
Avocado fruit bearing shoots. Left- from a healthy tree. Right- from a Zn- deficient tree.
'Hass' avocados: Right- harvested from a Zn- deficient tree. Leaf- havested from a normal tree.
'Hass' avocado. Right, fruit harvested from a tree with Zn deficiency. Left, fruits harvested from a normal tree.
B- deficient 'Hass' avocado fruits and shoot.
'Hass' avocado fruits. Left- from a B- deficient tree. Right- from a healthy tree.
Avocado shoot whose older leaves are affected by chloride excess.
Leaf symptoms of chloride excess in avovado.
